title: Geneva Int Centre for Humanit Demining 2010-2013
description: Funding under this proposal provides support to the Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD) for the elimination of anti-personnel mines and the reduction of the humanitarian impact of other landmines and explosive remnants of war. Activities supported by this funding include: Mine Ban Convention related activities including support for the Implementation Support Unit and sponsorship programs; support to the organisation's operational work in the Asia-Pacific region including the Pacific Region UXO workshop; land rights in conflict-affected countries; reducing armed violence; promoting gender-sensitive mine action; victim assistance research; monitoring and evaluation frameworks; land release; and promotion of International Mine Action Standards. The total value of this initiative is $2.7 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
